title: Restricted user is able to delete filter sets of admin users in https://infrastructure.newrelic.com/accounts/{{ACC#}}/settings/filterSets
vulnerability_information:
At this endpoint: `https://infrastructure.newrelic.com/accounts/████/settings/filterSets` the application does not properly check to ensure that a user with restricted settings is able to delete filters of other users, including a filter of an admin. 

## Step by step instructions

1. Admin creates a New Relic account, invites User1 as a restricted user to join the team
2. The admin creates a filter by navigating to Infrastructure > Inventory > Add Filter (`https://infrastructure.newrelic.com/accounts/███████/inventory`)
3. User2 joins the team, then clicks on "Infrastructure" tab
4. User2 clicks on "Settings", within Infrastructure. 
5. At this URL, User2 can click on the trash can icon next to the filter that the admin made, and then refresh the page. 
6. The admin's filter is deleted

The application on this page believes that the restricted user has an elevated privilege on this page, when in reality User2 is still a restricted user and should only have view-only settings. 

Please let me know if you have any additional questions, thanks.

Jon Bottarini
